structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases
Clerks, Attorneys And Other Officers Of Judicial Courts

text.section: grant such continuances as are agreed upon by all parties to any proceeding and as may be allowed by rule of court;
hear and rule on any uncontested non-evidentiary motion as may be allowed by rule of court;
call such pre-trial conferences as are deemed expedient for the purpose of ascertaining the trial readiness of parties to an action and of establishing a date for trial;
mediate actions under section twenty-two of chapter two hundred and eighteen;
receive citations and hold hearings pursuant to subsection A of section three of chapter ninety C.
receive petitions and review orders pursuant to section one hundred and fifty-seven of chapter one hundred and forty;
hold preliminary hearings to determine whether there is probable cause to believe that a probationer has violated the terms of his probation.
set bail on arraignments during the normal court day, when a justice is unavailable.
